data.text:
Climate change demands swift actions and measures from all sectors. Information on the organization's current emissions and willingness to achieve science-based targets are needed in order to identify efficient mitigation measures. Ambitious carbon roadmaps and planning of emissions reductions support the achievement of mitigation goals.

Our services include:

Support in planning climate mitigation

Studies and surveys

Planning and execution of stakeholder collaboration

Workshops both on-site and online

Evaluation

Examples of our client cases

Improving the climate change management practices of City of Kemi

Possibilities to increase the effectiveness of the Finnish Climate Act (UUSILMA)

Novel soil management practices – key for sustainable bioeconomy and climate change mitigation (SOMPA)

Managing climate initiatives

Climate change expert services for Technopolis Ltd.

Managing Pioneers into Practice -exchange programme

References

Study on the potential for carbon sequestration in natural environments in Central Finland. Regional Council of Central Finland. 2024. Report in Finnish.

Study concerning Finland's climate emissions, potential for emission reductions and vision for Nordic climate neutral society in Nordic Stocktake and Visions project. Reports available: Pathways to Climate Neutrality & Nordic Visions of Climate Neutrality. Nordic Council of Ministers. 2023.

Effectiveness with climate change management practices - The City of Kemi. The expert services concerning climate change work for the municipalities of Lapland. 2022-2023.

Carbon dioxide use and removal: Prospects and policies. Government's analysis, assesment and research activities. 2022-2023.

Pre-assessment for tools for municipalities to accelerate climate action and transition to circular economy. Ministry of the Environment. 2021 - 2022. Report in Finnish.

Nordic Dialogue on Voluntary Compensations. The Nordic Council of Ministers’ working group on Climate and Air (NKL). As a part of a consortium led by Perspectives Climate Research. 2021-2022. Final report.

A study on gender equality in Finland's international climate policy. Plan International Finland. 2020–2021.

Planning, facilitation and reporting of climate-related workshops for citizens, municipalities and companies in Central Finland. Regional Council of Central Finland. 2021.

Analysing policy papers on the European Climate Pact and 2030 emission targets for the European Commission as a part of a consortium led by Trinomics Ltd. 2020.

New measures in climate governance and strengthening the climate act. Government's analysis, assessment and research activities. 2020. Report in Finnish.

A brief summary of the key issues of the Paris Climate Agreement. Kalevi Sorsa Foundation. 2020. Publication in Finnish.

A brief summary of EU climate policy for decision-makers. Kalevi Sorsa Foundation. 2019. Publication in Finnish.

Planning, facilitation and reporting of a workshop to municipal decision-makers on the Carbon Neutral Kauniainen 2035 Roadmap. City of Kauniainen. 2019.

Management of the Pioneers into Practice exchange programme and the development of new business models, EIT Climate-KIC Knowledge and Innovation Community. Helsinki-Uusimaa Regional Council. 2017–2020.

Supporting Tales by Trees in estimating its net impact and striving for Net Positive. 2017.

Updating the programme of climate and energy actions (ILME) of Kauniainen municipality. 2016-2017.

Climate change expert services for Technopolis Ltd. Support for climate change reporting and target setting and concept development of low carbon services. 2016-2017.

Support of the climate work of Citycon Corporation. 2015.

Expert report for the Committee for the Future of the Finnish Parliament on the relation between innovations and combating climate change in four fields: buildings, traffic, food and participation of citizens. 2015.
